caption: b'We encourage friendship and unity to create a good working\xc2\xa0environment around us. The\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x9cBlimE\xe2\x80\x9d\xc2\xa0campaign\xc2\xa0in Norway\xc2\xa0promotes these two factors, and this year the\xc2\xa0employees\xc2\xa0at the Johan Sverdrup field have taken the challenge and joined in! #together'

b"Earlier this week marked the 15-year anniversary of production start for the Kristin field in the Norwegian Sea. With record-high pressure (910 bar) and very high temperature (170 degrees) in the reservoir, Kristin is one of the most demanding underwater developments ever carried out on the Norwegian shelf.\n\xc2\xa0\nWhile some of the pressure in the Kristin field has reduced during its 15 years in production, the workers on board are still keeping up the engagement. And, with creativity and commitment, we'll still maintain a high production level for years to come."

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re excited to present 2 great pieces of news on 2 November. Say hello to our new CEO Anders Opedal\xe2\x80\xa6and to our net-zero climate ambition, too :smiling_face_with_smiling_eyes:'

b'Hip hip hooray \xe2\x80\x93 the Heidrun field turns 25 today! :partying_face:  The field is our first installation to produce in the Norwegian Sea and has since its inception in 1995 produced a formidable 1.25 billion barrels of oil. We give thanks for the good apprentice help shown here, all of the Heidrun employees now and in years past, and look forward to continuing the cooperation in the years to come!'

b'How do you earn 1,000,000,000,000 Norwegian kroner? Ask Philip Harnes, who is an apprentice on board \xc3\x85sgard B in the Norwegian Sea. 

Philip, who comes from Elnesv\xc3\xa5gen from M\xc3\xb8re og Romsdal, began this fall as a process/chemical apprentice at the field. 

Over the last 20 years \xc3\x85sgard B has delivered oil and gas to the tune of over 1 trillion Norwegian kroner. Not a bad return for one of the most advanced and complicated fields that has even been constructed. 

(Photographer: Reidar Korssj\xc3\xb8en)'
b'Sometimes words are superfluous... What a view - and what lucky colleagues we have that can fish off the Snorre B platform:smiling_face_selector: Photo: @idamjos'

b'The world\xe2\x80\x99s first facility for seabed gas compression has been in operation for 5 years as of today, and what a success it\xe2\x80\x99s been. The facility sits at 300 metres sea depth, is the size of a football pitch and is put together in modules (kind of like Lego blocks). It runs like clockwork and has contributed to increased value creation at the \xc3\x85sgard field to the tune of tens of billions of Norwegian kroner! :clapping_hands_light_skin_tone: for clever minds and technology development!'

b'Emergency preparedness is a place for collaboration, not competitive advantage. In Norway private companies and the public sector join forces on the best possible preparedness. :flexed_biceps: We work closely with the 330 Squadron, :helicopter: which is constantly out on the Norwegian shelf in connection with exercises and training. It makes for an impressive sight here at the Kristin platform!'

b"\xe2\x80\x9cVocational subjects can be a bit looked down upon by some, but it\xe2\x80\x99s important to find your own way and not think about what all your friends are doing when choosing an education. When I tell people that I work on an oil platform, they think it's cool,\xe2\x80\x9d says 20-year-old Anne Eline. She had her entire apprenticeship on the Kristin platform in the Norwegian Sea and recently passed the process operator exam. Congratulations, Anne Eline! :clapping_hands_light_skin_tone::party_popper:"

b'We recently carried out a joint training between our search and rescue helicopter (SAR) and man overboard (MOB) boat crew at the Johan Sverdrup field in the North Sea. Nine lucky employees were chosen from the volunteers to participate in glorious weather and made a memory they won\xe2\x80\x99t soon forget. :sun_selector::ferry::helicopter:'

b'The Martin Linge platform receives shore power via the world\xe2\x80\x99s longest alternating-current sea cable, measuring 162 kilometres from the onshore substation at Kollsnes north of Bergen, Norway to the platform. Shore power will reduce CO2 emissions by 200,000 tons per year \xe2\x80\x93 the equivalent of emissions from 100,000 cars. :camera_with_flash:: \xc3\x98rjan Olsen @orjanoolsen'

b'Did you know that we own Denmark\xe2\x80\x99s largest oil refinery, Kalundborg, which has 2,500 kilometers of pipeline and the tanks are so large that they would have space to house a football pitch? (Placing a football pitch here would not be a good idea, of course...:winking_face:)'

b'The sun doesn\xe2\x80\x99t always shine on the helideck (unlike TV). But when it does, it can be used for all kinds of activities. Like taekwondo. Here\xe2\x80\x99s Omid carrying out his training on the Statfjord B helideck. We wish you all a sporty, outdoors summer :sun_with_face::man_cartwheeling_selector::person_lifting_weights_selector:'

b'Magical dawn at Johan Sverdrup :fog::smiling_face_with_heart-eyes: Did you know that thanks to largely hydroelectric power from shore Johan Sverdrup has 80-90% less CO2 emissions compared to a standard development employing gas turbines? \n:camera_with_flash:: Sindre Lorentzen'

b'Why should we carry out carbon capture and storage? Because it\xe2\x80\x99s a necessary step to deliver on the Paris agreement. The Northern Lights project is planning to transport 800,000 tonnes of CO2 a year from the energy recovery plant at Klemetsrud and the Norcem cement plant in Norway and store this permanently in a reservoir under the seabed. :water_wave: We\xe2\x80\x99ve been storing CO2 for over 20 years on some of our own projects \xe2\x80\x93 and now we\xe2\x80\x99re taking it a step further to help reduce carbon emissions from other industrial processes. :chart_decreasing:'

b'In 2020 more than 6000 of our employees in Norway and abroad :woman_construction_worker_medium-light_skin_tone::construction_worker_light_skin_tone: will solve their tasks differently as part of a step-up of sophisticated digital solutions. One aspect is the digital field worker concept, which will be rolled out to around 30 installations on the Norwegian continental shelf over the next two years. It may look like a slide, but the fibre shown is more work than play as a part of state-of-the-art WiFi networks offshore. Portable units :mobile_phone: and customised applications will contribute to a simpler, safer and more efficient workday for employees on our offshore installations.'

b"We're developing a new concept, the world's first subsea drone to transport CO2, oil \xe2\x80\x93 and a lot more. With an impressive size! :star-struck: Look at how large our subsea shuttle would be if it had been placed in the harbor of Stavanger, Norway :Norway: #technology #innovation #drone"

b'Have you ever wondered why all wind turbines are white? :artist_palette: It is both so that they blend in more with the surrounding environment and because the white color reflects the sun\xe2\x80\x99s rays and protects the surface of the blades and tower. And did you know that the Dudgeon wind farm, pictured here, produces enough green, clean energy to power more than 410,000 UK :house_with_garden: homes?'

b'How cool would it be if we powered oil and gas platforms with electricity from floating wind turbines? The Norwegian Ministry of Petroleum and Industry recently approved the Hywind Tampen wind farm development and operations plan. This means that the Snorre and Gullfaks platforms will be the first in the world to receive power from a floating offshore wind farm :star-struck: The pioneering project will reduce annual CO2 emissions equivalent to 100,000 private cars.'

b'Now, more than ever, safety and caring for people comes first. In Equinor, #health and #safety are always our top priority\xe2\x80\x94but the magnitude of the corona crisis calls for a broader contribution. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99re announcing donations of USD 500,000 each to @nrc_flyktninghjelpen and the COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund in support of the World Health Organization powered by Swiss Philanthropy Foundation and UN Foundation. #coronavirus #covid19'

b'The oil & gas industry in Mexico stands with women fighting against gender violence. Equality is so fundamental to Equinor that it\xe2\x80\x99s reflected in our name. Our people in Mexico have been empowered to spend 9 March in support of the #UnD\xc3\xadaSinMujeres movement. \xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94 La industria de petr\xc3\xb3leo y gas en M\xc3\xa9xico apoya a las mujeres en su lucha en contra de la violencia de g\xc3\xa9nero. La igualdad es tan importante para Equinor que forma parte de nuestro nombre. Nuestro equipo en M\xc3\xa9xico ha sido empoderado para pasar el 9 de marzo en apoyo a #Und\xc3\xadaSinMujeres #UnDiaSinNosotras #9M'

b"Equinor is committed to equality and a gender equal future. Today we celebrate the valuable contribution and achievements of our female colleagues. Find out how we're putting that commitment into practice. \xe2\x80\x8b
\xe2\x80\x8b
Find out more via link in bio
#EachForEqual #OurFutureIsEqual #IWD2020 \xe2\x80\x8b"

b'Less than 4 %. That\xe2\x80\x99s how little CO2 the Johan Sverdrup field emits from oil production compared to the world :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: average. Thanks to largely hydroelectric power from shore, we will avoid emissions of more than 620,000 tonnes of CO2 every single year.'

b'More than 85% of fossil fuel greenhouse gas emissions come from consumption. The global ambition in our new #climate roadmap is that the emission intensity of the energy we produce in 2050 \xe2\x80\x93 from production to consumption \xe2\x80\x93 will be less than half of what is it today. :chart_decreasing:'
b'Our new climate ambitions in Norway are to reduce emissions by 40% by 2030 and to as close to zero emissions as possible by 2050 :up-right_arrow:'
